arguments.summary: If true, adds a PG tag to created SAM/BAM/CRAM files.
arguments.name: --add-output-sam-program-record

arguments.summary: If true, adds a command line header line to created VCF files.
arguments.name: --add-output-vcf-command-line

arguments.summary: read one or more arguments files and add them to the command line
arguments.name: --arguments_file

arguments.summary: Length (in bp) of the bins.  If zero, no binning will be performed.
arguments.name: --bin-length

arguments.summary: Size of the cloud-only prefetch buffer (in MB; 0 to disable). Defaults to cloudPrefetchBuffer if unset.
arguments.name: --cloud-index-prefetch-buffer

arguments.summary: Size of the cloud-only prefetch buffer (in MB; 0 to disable).
arguments.name: --cloud-prefetch-buffer

arguments.summary: If true, create a BAM/CRAM index when writing a coordinate-sorted BAM/CRAM file.
arguments.name: --create-output-bam-index

arguments.summary: If true, create a MD5 digest for any BAM/SAM/CRAM file created
arguments.name: --create-output-bam-md5

arguments.summary: If true, create a VCF index when writing a coordinate-sorted VCF file.
arguments.name: --create-output-variant-index

arguments.summary: If true, create a a MD5 digest any VCF file created.
arguments.name: --create-output-variant-md5

arguments.summary: If true, don't cache bam indexes, this will reduce memory requirements but may harm performance if many intervals are specified.  Caching is automatically disabled if there are no intervals specified.
arguments.name: --disable-bam-index-caching

arguments.summary: Read filters to be disabled before analysis
arguments.name: --disable-read-filter

arguments.summary: If specified, do not check the sequence dictionaries from our inputs for compatibility. Use at your own risk!
arguments.name: --disable-sequence-dictionary-validation

arguments.summary: Disable all tool default read filters (WARNING: many tools will not function correctly without their default read filters on)
arguments.name: --disable-tool-default-read-filters

arguments.summary: One or more genomic intervals to exclude from processing
arguments.name: --exclude-intervals
arguments.fulltext:
Use this argument to exclude certain parts of the genome from the analysis (like -L, but the opposite).
 This argument can be specified multiple times. You can use samtools-style intervals either explicitly on the
 command line (e.g. -XL 1 or -XL 1:100-200) or by loading in a file containing a list of intervals
 (e.g. -XL myFile.intervals).

arguments.summary: A configuration file to use with the GATK.
arguments.name: --gatk-config-file

arguments.summary: If the GCS bucket channel errors out, how many times it will attempt to re-initiate the connection
arguments.name: --gcs-max-retries

arguments.summary: Project to bill when accessing "requester pays" buckets. If unset, these buckets cannot be accessed.  User must have storage.buckets.get permission on the bucket being accessed.
arguments.name: --gcs-project-for-requester-pays

arguments.summary: display the help message
arguments.name: --help

arguments.summary: BAM/SAM/CRAM file containing reads
arguments.name: --input

arguments.summary: Amount of padding (in bp) to add to each interval you are excluding.
arguments.name: --interval-exclusion-padding
arguments.fulltext:
Use this to add padding to the intervals specified using -XL. For example, '-XL 1:100' with a
 padding value of 20 would turn into '-XL 1:80-120'. This is typically used to add padding around targets when
 analyzing exomes.

arguments.summary: Interval merging rule for abutting intervals
arguments.name: --interval-merging-rule
arguments.fulltext:
By default, the program merges abutting intervals (i.e. intervals that are directly side-by-side but do not
 actually overlap) into a single continuous interval. However you can change this behavior if you want them to be
 treated as separate intervals instead.

arguments.summary: Amount of padding (in bp) to add to each interval you are including.
arguments.name: --interval-padding
arguments.fulltext:
Use this to add padding to the intervals specified using -L. For example, '-L 1:100' with a
 padding value of 20 would turn into '-L 1:80-120'. This is typically used to add padding around targets when
 analyzing exomes.

arguments.summary: Set merging approach to use for combining interval inputs
arguments.name: --interval-set-rule
arguments.fulltext:
By default, the program will take the UNION of all intervals specified using -L and/or -XL. However, you can
 change this setting for -L, for example if you want to take the INTERSECTION of the sets instead. E.g. to
 perform the analysis only on chromosome 1 exomes, you could specify -L exomes.intervals -L 1 --interval-set-rule
 INTERSECTION. However, it is not possible to modify the merging approach for intervals passed using -XL (they will
 always be merged using UNION).

 Note that if you specify both -L and -XL, the -XL interval set will be subtracted from the -L interval set.

options.summary: Take the union of all intervals
options.name: UNION

options.summary: Take the intersection of intervals (the subset that overlaps all intervals specified)
options.name: INTERSECTION

arguments.summary: One or more genomic intervals over which to operate
arguments.name: --intervals

arguments.summary: Lenient processing of VCF files
arguments.name: --lenient

arguments.summary: If non-zero, partitions VCF output into shards, each containing up to the given number of records.
arguments.name: --max-variants-per-shard

arguments.summary: Output Picard interval-list file containing the preprocessed intervals.
arguments.name: --output

arguments.summary: Length (in bp) of the padding regions on each side of the intervals.
arguments.name: --padding

arguments.summary: Whether to suppress job-summary info on System.err.
arguments.name: --QUIET

arguments.summary: Read filters to be applied before analysis
arguments.name: --read-filter

arguments.summary: Indices to use for the read inputs. If specified, an index must be provided for every read input and in the same order as the read inputs. If this argument is not specified, the path to the index for each input will be inferred automatically.
arguments.name: --read-index

arguments.summary: Validation stringency for all SAM/BAM/CRAM/SRA files read by this program.  The default stringency value SILENT can improve performance when processing a BAM file in which variable-length data (read, qualities, tags) do not otherwise need to be decoded.
arguments.name: --read-validation-stringency

arguments.summary: Reference sequence file
arguments.name: --reference

arguments.summary: Output traversal statistics every time this many seconds elapse
arguments.name: --seconds-between-progress-updates

arguments.summary: Use the given sequence dictionary as the master/canonical sequence dictionary.  Must be a .dict file.
arguments.name: --sequence-dictionary

arguments.summary: display hidden arguments
arguments.name: --showHidden

arguments.summary: If true, don't emit genotype fields when writing vcf file output.
arguments.name: --sites-only-vcf-output

arguments.summary: Temp directory to use.
arguments.name: --tmp-dir

arguments.summary: Whether to use the JdkDeflater (as opposed to IntelDeflater)
arguments.name: --use-jdk-deflater

arguments.summary: Whether to use the JdkInflater (as opposed to IntelInflater)
arguments.name: --use-jdk-inflater

arguments.summary: Control verbosity of logging.
arguments.name: --verbosity

arguments.summary: display the version number for this tool
arguments.name: --version

description:
Prepares bins for coverage collection.

The input intervals are first checked for overlapping intervals, which are merged. The resulting intervals are then padded. The padded intervals are then split into bins. Finally, bins that contain only Ns are filtered out.

Inputs

  • Reference FASTA file
  • Intervals to be preprocessed. The argument interval-merging-rule must be set to IntervalMergingRule#OVERLAPPING_ONLY and all other common arguments for interval padding or merging must be set to their defaults. If no intervals are specified, then each contig will be assumed to be a single interval and binned accordingly; this produces bins appropriate for whole genome sequencing analyses.
  • Padding length (in bp). Use padding to specify the size of each of the regions added to both ends of the intervals that result after overlapping intervals have been merged. Do not use the common interval-padding argument. Intervals that would overlap after padding by the specified amount are instead only padded until they are adjacent.
  • Bin length (in bp). If this length is not commensurate with the length of a padded interval, then the last bin will be of different length than the others in that interval. If zero is specified, then no binning will be performed; this is generally appropriate for targeted analyses.

Outputs

  • Preprocessed Picard interval-list file.

Usage examples

To pad intervals by 250 bases and disable binning (e.g., for targeted analyses): 
     gatk PreprocessIntervals \
          -R reference.fa \
          -L intervals.interval_list \
          --bin-length 0 \
          --padding 250 \
          -O preprocessed_intervals.interval_list
To generate consecutive bins of 1000 bases from the reference (e.g., for whole genome sequencing analyses): 
     gatk PreprocessIntervals \
          -R reference.fa \
          --bin-length 1000 \
          --padding 0 \
          -O preprocessed_intervals.interval_list
name: PreprocessIntervals
